notes.title: NOTES 1 : FILE LOCATION
notes.body:
| Component | File |
|-----------|------|
| **Main Call Router** | `routes/v2twilio.js` |
| **AI Agent Runtime** | `services/v2AIAgentRuntime.js` |
| **TTS Service** | `services/v2elevenLabsService.js` |
| **Call State Management** | `services/engine/CallRuntime.js` |
| **AI Brain** | `services/HybridReceptionistLLM.js` |
| **STT Processing** | `services/STTPreprocessor.js` |
| **Agent2 Discovery** | `services/engine/agent2/Agent2DiscoveryRunner.js` |
| **ScrabEngine** | `services/ScrabEngine.js` |
| **Trigger Matcher** | `services/engine/agent2/TriggerCardMatcher.js` |

notes.title: Notes 2. Key Services | Purpose | Code Location
notes.body:
Service |	Purpose |  Code Location

1. CallRuntime | Orchestrates turn processing | services/engine/CallRuntime.js

2. Agent2DiscoveryRunner | Discovery mode handler | services/engine/agent2/Agent2DiscoveryRunner.js

3. TriggerCardMatcher | Evaluates all triggers | services/engine/agent2/TriggerCardMatcher.js

4. HybridReceptionistLLM	| LLM fallback | services/HybridReceptionistLLM.js

5. ScrabEngine | Text normalization & entity extraction | services/ScrabEngine.js

6. Agent2GreetingInterceptor | Greeting detection (runs FIRST) | services/engine/agent2/Agent2GreetingInterceptor.js

notes.title: 1. Twilio Entry
notes.body:
POST /api/twilio/voice

When customer calls, Twilio finds phone number, looks up companyId

File: routes/v2twilio.js:1004

notes.title: 2. Gatekeeper
notes.body:
Configuration check:
- Active ‚Üí continue
- Call Forward ‚Üí transfer to number
- Suspended ‚Üí play message & hangup

File: routes/v2twilio.js:1328

notes.title: 3. Spam Filter
notes.body:
SmartCallFilter.checkCall()

Blocks spam calls (global or local blocklist)
If blocked ‚Üí hangup immediately

File: routes/v2twilio.js:1050

notes.title: 4. Call Start Greeting
notes.body:
Agent 2.0 Greeting (on call connect)

Options:
- Prerecorded audio (ElevenLabs)
- TTS (text-to-speech)
- Disabled (skip greeting)

File: routes/v2twilio.js:1578-1947
UI: agent2.html ‚Üí Greetings tab

notes.title: 5. Gather Setup (Deepgram STT)
notes.body:
Twilio <Gather> configured:
- input: 'speech'
- action: /api/twilio/v2-agent-respond/:companyId
- enhanced: true (Deepgram)
- speechModel: 'phone_call'

File: routes/v2twilio.js:1644-1682

notes.title: 6. Customer Speaks
notes.body:
Customer says: "I need to schedule a service"

‚Üí Twilio captures audio
‚Üí Deepgram transcribes (Speech-to-Text)
‚Üí Returns transcript to Twilio

notes.title: 7. SpeechResult Posted
notes.body:
Twilio posts to action URL:

POST /api/twilio/v2-agent-respond/:companyId
Body: {
  SpeechResult: "I need to schedule a service",
  CallSid: "CA...",
  Confidence: 0.95
}

File: routes/v2twilio.js:3523

notes.title: 10. üîç SCRABENGINE (4-STEP PROCESS)
notes.body:
üö® CRITICAL: Runs IMMEDIATELY after SpeechResult

File: services/ScrabEngine.js
Called from: Agent2DiscoveryRunner.js:605

4-STEP PIPELINE:

STEP 1: FILLER REMOVAL
- Remove: "um", "uh", "like", "you know"
- Remove: "hi", "hello", "hey" (greeting words)
- Apply mishear corrections

STEP 2: VOCABULARY EXPANSION
- Normalize: "acee" ‚Üí "ac" ‚Üí "air conditioning"
- Normalize: "tstat" ‚Üí "thermostat"
- Normalize: "furnace" ‚Üí "heating system"
- Industry-specific expansions

STEP 3: SYNONYM MAPPING
- Map common phrases to standard terms
- Handle regional variations
- Expand abbreviations

STEP 4: ENTITY EXTRACTION
- Extract: firstName, lastName
- Extract: phone, email, address
- Extract: custom fields (service type, urgency)
- Quality gate (filter garbage input)

OUTPUT:
- normalizedText (cleaned, ready for matching)
- entities (structured data)
- expandedTokens (vocabulary hints)

EXAMPLE:
Input:  "Hi I need emergency acee service"
‚Üì Step 1: "need emergency acee service" (removed "hi")
‚Üì Step 2: "need emergency ac service" (acee ‚Üí ac)
‚Üì Step 3: "need emergency air conditioning service"
‚Üì Step 4: entities: { urgency: "emergency", serviceType: "ac" }

notes.title: 10a. ScrabEngine Step 1: Filler Removal
notes.body:
Remove speech fillers and greeting words:

- "um", "uh", "like", "you know", "I mean"
- "hi", "hello", "hey", "good morning", "good afternoon"
- Mishear corrections

EXAMPLE:
"Hi um I need emergency service"
‚Üí "need emergency service"

notes.title: 10b. ScrabEngine Step 2: Vocabulary Expansion
notes.body:
Normalize industry-specific terms:

- "acee" ‚Üí "ac" ‚Üí "air conditioning"
- "tstat" ‚Üí "thermostat"
- "furnace" ‚Üí "heating system"
- "hvac" ‚Üí "heating ventilation air conditioning"

EXAMPLE:
"need emergency acee service"
‚Üí "need emergency ac service"

notes.title: 10c. ScrabEngine Step 3: Synonym Mapping
notes.body:
Map common phrases to standard terms:

- "broken" ‚Üí "not working", "malfunctioning"
- "asap" ‚Üí "urgent", "emergency"
- Regional variations

EXAMPLE:
"ac is broken asap"
‚Üí "air conditioning not working urgent"

notes.title: 10d. ScrabEngine Step 4: Entity Extraction
notes.body:
Extract structured data + Quality Gate:

ENTITIES:
- firstName, lastName
- phone, email, address
- serviceType, urgency level
- custom fields

QUALITY GATE:
- Filter garbage input
- Validate entity confidence
- Check minimum quality threshold

EXAMPLE OUTPUT:
normalizedText: "need emergency air conditioning service"
entities: {
  urgency: "emergency",
  serviceType: "air_conditioning"
}

notes.title: 11. Load Call State
notes.body:
StateStore.load(callState)

Loads from Redis:
- Turn count
- Session mode (DISCOVERY/BOOKING)
- Extracted entities (name, phone, etc.)
- Conversation history

File: services/engine/StateStore.js

notes.title: 12. CallRuntime.processTurn()
notes.body:
Main orchestrator - routes to correct engine

IF booking mode ‚Üí BookingLogicEngine
ELSE ‚Üí Agent2DiscoveryRunner

File: services/engine/CallRuntime.js:293

notes.title: 13. Agent2DiscoveryRunner.run()
notes.body:
Discovery mode handler

Receives CLEANED text from ScrabEngine!

Responsible for:
- Greeting detection (on CLEANED text)
- Trigger matching (on CLEANED text)
- LLM fallback

File: services/engine/agent2/Agent2DiscoveryRunner.js:396

notes.title: 14. üö® GREETING INTERCEPTOR (NOW FIXED!)
notes.body:
‚úÖ NOW RECEIVES CLEANED TEXT FROM SCRABENGINE!

File: Agent2DiscoveryRunner.js:516-583
Function: Agent2GreetingInterceptor.evaluate()

Checks CLEANED text:
- Is input a greeting? ("hi", "hello", "good morning")
- Short-only gate (‚â§3-5 words)
- No intent words detected

‚úÖ FIXED EXAMPLE:
Raw input: "Hi I need emergency service"
‚Üì ScrabEngine removed "Hi" (Step 1)
‚Üì Greeting Interceptor sees: "need emergency service"
‚Üì NO greeting match (has intent words)
‚Üì Continues to trigger matching ‚úÖ
‚Üì EMERGENCY TRIGGER FIRES ‚úÖ

OLD BUG (if ScrabEngine ran later):
- Greeting Interceptor saw: "Hi I need emergency service"
- Matched "Hi" ‚Üí returned early
- Never reached ScrabEngine or triggers ‚ùå

notes.title: 15. Name Greeting (Turn 1 Only)
notes.body:
Optional personalized greeting:

"Got it{name}." ‚Üí "Got it, Marc."

Only fires on turn 1 if:
- Name was extracted by ScrabEngine
- Name greeting enabled in config

File: Agent2DiscoveryRunner.js:335-355

notes.title: 16. Hold Modal Check
notes.body:
Patience Mode Detection:

Keywords: "please hold", "one moment", "give me a second"

If matched:
- Enter patience mode
- Set timeout (default 45s)
- Check-in after timeout
- Max 2 check-ins before continuing

File: Agent2DiscoveryRunner.js (patience logic)

notes.title: 17. üéØ TRIGGER EVALUATION (ON CLEANED TEXT)
notes.body:
TriggerCardMatcher.match()

File: services/engine/agent2/TriggerCardMatcher.js
Called from: Agent2DiscoveryRunner.js:1473-1474

‚úÖ NOW MATCHES ON CLEANED TEXT FROM SCRABENGINE!

Matching logic:
1. Load compiled triggers (global + company)
2. Check keywords/phrases (on CLEANED text)
3. Check negative keywords (disqualifiers)
4. Priority-based ranking
5. Return best match

EXAMPLE:
Raw: "Hi I need emergency acee service"
‚Üì ScrabEngine cleaned to: "need emergency air conditioning service"
‚Üì Trigger matcher sees: "emergency" + "air conditioning"
‚Üì Matches: EMERGENCY_AC_SERVICE trigger ‚úÖ

Logged as: A2_TRIGGER_EVAL

notes.title: 18a. IF TRIGGER MATCHED
notes.body:
Fast path (instant response):

‚Üí Use trigger response text
‚Üí Use pre-recorded audio (if exists)
‚Üí SKIP LLM (no GPT-4 call needed!)
‚Üí Return in ~200ms

Logged as: SPEECH_SOURCE_SELECTED

notes.title: Path 1: Trigger Match (Fast!)
notes.body:
Example: "I need to schedule service"

‚Üì
TriggerCardMatcher finds: "Schedule Service" card
‚Üì
Use pre-configured response
‚Üì
Use pre-recorded audio (if exists) - SKIP TTS!
‚Üì
Return in ~200ms

notes.title: 18b. IF NO TRIGGER MATCHED
notes.body:
Fallback to LLM:

‚Üí HybridReceptionistLLM
‚Üí OpenAI GPT-4
‚Üí Generate dynamic response
‚Üí ElevenLabs TTS ‚Üí audio
‚Üí Return in ~2-3 seconds

Logged as: LLM_FALLBACK_USED

notes.title: Path 2: No Match (Flexible!)
notes.body:
Example: "What's your warranty policy?"

‚Üì
No trigger card matches
‚Üì
Fall back to HybridReceptionistLLM
‚Üì
GPT-4 generates dynamic response
‚Üì
ElevenLabs TTS ‚Üí audio
‚Üì
Return in ~2-3 seconds

notes.title: 19. Handoff to Booking
notes.body:
IF trigger indicates booking intent:

‚Üí Switch to BOOKING mode
‚Üí Pass extracted entities to BookingLogicEngine
‚Üí Start booking flow

Entities passed (from ScrabEngine Step 4):
- firstName, lastName
- phone, email, address
- serviceType, urgency
- call reason
- any custom extractions

notes.title: 20. BookingLogicEngine
notes.body:
Booking flow handler (if in booking mode)

Receives pre-extracted entities from ScrabEngine!

Steps:
1. Name collection (may skip if already extracted)
2. Phone verification
3. Address capture
4. Service details
5. Appointment scheduling
6. Confirmation

File: services/engine/booking/BookingLogicEngine.js

notes.title: ‚úÖ CORRECTED SEQUENCE SUMMARY
notes.body:
1-2.  Documentation Notes
3.    Twilio Entry
4.    Gatekeeper Check
5.    Spam Filter
6.    Call Start Greeting (audio)
7.    Gather Setup (Deepgram)
8.    Customer Speaks
9.    SpeechResult Posted

üîç 10.   SCRABENGINE (4-STEP PROCESS) ‚Üê RUNS FIRST!
      10a. Step 1: Filler Removal (removes "hi", "hello")
      10b. Step 2: Vocabulary Expansion ("acee" ‚Üí "ac")
      10c. Step 3: Synonym Mapping ("broken" ‚Üí "not working")
      10d. Step 4: Entity Extraction + Quality Gate

11.   Load Call State
12.   CallRuntime.processTurn()
13.   Agent2DiscoveryRunner.run()

‚úÖ 14.   Greeting Interceptor (NOW receives CLEANED text!)
      ‚Üí Sees "need emergency service" (not "Hi I need...")
      ‚Üí No greeting match ‚Üí continues ‚úÖ

15.   Name Greeting (turn 1, if extracted)
16.   Hold Modal Check

üéØ 17.   TRIGGER EVALUATION (on CLEANED text)
      ‚Üí Matched ‚Üí fast response (18a)
      ‚Üí No match ‚Üí LLM fallback (18b)

18a.  IF MATCHED: Use trigger response (~200ms)
18b.  IF NO MATCH: GPT-4 fallback (~2-3s)

19.   Handoff to Booking (if booking intent)
20.   BookingLogicEngine (receives pre-extracted entities)

üéâ FIX: ScrabEngine now runs at sequence 10, BEFORE greeting check!
   This ensures greeting words are removed before any decision logic.

connections.label: IF greeting (on CLEANED text) ‚Üí skip to name greeting
